info.name: SUTD EOSE Service APIs
info.description:
Service APIs for EOSE provided by the ACNAPI team.

Do note that these are APIs that are provided by us to help bootstrap your development. You are encouraged to source for your own APIs (as well as database) that will enhance the development of your product. 

Also, we will be giving each of you a server token to access these APIs. As a form of good code practice and governance, please do not store this server token in public repositories (i.e. github, bitbucket, gitab).

Ping us on slack if you have any issues with these APIs!

url.raw: https://ug-api.acnapiv3.io/swivel/topic-extraction/topics-2.0?of=json&lang=en&ilang=en&tt=a&uw=y&txt=Topics Extraction is for extracting the different elements present in sources of information. This detection process is carried out by combining a number of complex natural language processing techniques that allow to obtain morphological, syntactic and semantic analyses of a text and use them to identify different types of significant elements.

query.description: Output format
It specifies the language in which the text must be analyzed. en: English es: Spanish it: Italian fr: French pt: Portuguese ca: Catalan da: Danish sv: Swedish no: Norwegian fi: Finnish

It specifies the language in which the values returned will appear (in the case where they are known). en: English es: Spanish it: Italian fr: French pt: Portuguese ca: Catalan da: Danish sv: Swedish no: Norwegian fi: Finnish

The list of topic types to extract will be specified through a string with the letters assigned to each one of the topic types that are to be extracted. e: named entities c: concepts t: time expressions m: money expressions n: quantity expressions [beta] o: other expressions q: quotations r: relations a: all

Deal with unknown words. This feature adds a stage to the topic extraction in which the engine, much like a spellchecker, tries to find a suitable analysis to the unknown words resulted from the initial analysis assignment. It is specially useful to decrease the impact typos have in text analyses. y: enabled n: disabled

query.value: Topics Extraction is for extracting the different elements present in sources of information. This detection process is carried out by combining a number of complex natural language processing techniques that allow to obtain morphological, syntactic and semantic analyses of a text and use them to identify different types of significant elements.
query.description: Input text to be analyzed

request.description:
Topics Extraction is for extracting the different elements present in sources of information. This detection process is carried out by combining a number of complex natural language processing techniques that allow to obtain morphological, syntactic and semantic analyses of a text and use them to identify different types of significant elements.

For more information, refer to: https://www.meaningcloud.com/developer/topics-extraction/doc

url.raw:
https://ug-api.acnapiv3.io/swivel/text-clustering/clustering-1.1?of=json&txt="text01": "He earns $200,000/yr and still has a mortgage on his house :("

"text02": "Zara clothes will be the death of my credit card"

"text03": "My bank insisted I destroyed my credit card before I could get a mortgage"

"text04": "I'm not paying the mortgage or credit card bills"

"text05": "Tell them you've never had a loan, you have no mortgage"&lang=en

query.description: Output format

query.value:
"text01": "He earns $200,000/yr and still has a mortgage on his house :("

"text02": "Zara clothes will be the death of my credit card"

"text03": "My bank insisted I destroyed my credit card before I could get a mortgage"

"text04": "I'm not paying the mortgage or credit card bills"

"text05": "Tell them you've never had a loan, you have no mortgage"
query.description: Text input to be analyzed
It specifies the language in which the text is. en: English es: Spanish it: Italian fr: French pt: Portuguese ca: Catalan da: Danish sv: Swedish no: Norwegian fi: Finnish

request.description:
This is for automatic document clustering, i.e., the task of grouping a set of texts in such a way that texts in the same group (called a cluster) are more similar to each other than to those in other clusters.

The algorithm receives a set of texts and returns the list of detected clusters. Each cluster is assigned a descriptive name, a relevance value (indicating the relative importance of the cluster with respect to all clusters), its size, and the list of elements that are included in the cluster. Each document may be assigned to one or several clusters.

Text clustering may be used for different tasks, such as grouping similar documents (news, tweets, etc.) and the analysis of customer/employee feedback, discovering meaningful implicit subjects across all documents.

For more information, refer to: https://www.meaningcloud.com/developer/text-clustering/doc

item.name: Sentiment Analysis

url.raw: https://ug-api.acnapiv3.io/swivel/sentiment-analysis/sentiment-2.1?of=json&lang=en&ilang=en&uw=y&txt=Main dishes were quite good, but desserts were too sweet for me. Overall the meal was a decent experience.

query.description: Output format
It specifies the language in which the text must be analyzed. en: English es: Spanish it: Italian fr: French pt: Portuguese ca: Catalan da: Danish sv: Swedish no: Norwegian fi: Finnish

It specifies the language in which the values returned will appear (in the case where they are known). en: English es: Spanish it: Italian fr: French pt: Portuguese ca: Catalan da: Danish sv: Swedish no: Norwegian fi: Finnish

Deal with unknown words. This feature adds a stage to the topic extraction in which the engine, much like a spellchecker, tries to find a suitable analysis to the unknown words resulted from the initial analysis assignment. It is specially useful to decrease the impact typos have in text analyses. y: enabled n: disabled

query.value: Main dishes were quite good, but desserts were too sweet for me. Overall the meal was a decent experience.
query.description: Text input to be analyzed

request.description:
Sentiment Analysis is MeaningCloud's solution for performing a detailed multilingual sentiment analysis of texts from different sources.

The text provided is analyzed to determine if it expresses a positive/negative/neutral sentiment; to do this, the local polarity of the different sentences in the text is identified and the relationship between them evaluated, resulting in a global polarity value for the whole text.

Besides polarity at sentence and global level, Sentiment Analysis uses advanced natural language processing techniques to also detect the polarity associated to both entities and concepts in the text. It provides a reference in the relevant sentence and a list of elements detected with the aggregated polarity derived from all their appearances, also taking into account the grammatical structures in which they are contained.

For more information, refer to: https://www.meaningcloud.com/developer/sentiment-analysis/doc

item.description:

Besides polarity at sentence and global level, Sentiment Analysis uses advanced natural language processing techniques to also detect the polarity associated to both entities and concepts in the text. It provides a reference in the relevant sentence and a list of elements detected with the aggregated polarity derived from all their appearances, also taking into account the grammatical structures in which they are contained.

item.name: Text Classification

url.raw: https://ug-api.acnapiv3.io/swivel/text-classification/class-1.1?of=json&txt=The 85th Academy Awards ceremony took place February 24, 2013.&model=IPTC_en

query.description: Output format

query.value: The 85th Academy Awards ceremony took place February 24, 2013.
query.description: Text input to be analyzed
Descriptive title of the content. The terms relevant for the classification process found in the title will have more influence in the classification than if they were in the text.

Verbose mode. When active, it shows additional information about the classification, specifically, it shows the terms that have been used for classifying a text within a category along with how they influence the relevance of the category for the processed text

Classification model to use. It will define into which categories the text may be classified. required IPTC_en: English IPTC model. IPTC_es: Spanish IPTC model. IPTC_fr: French IPTC model. IPTC_it: Italian IPTC model. IPTC_pt: Portuguese IPTC model. IPTC_ca: Catalan IPTC model. EUROVOC_es_ca: EuroVoc EU's multilingual thesaurus (Spanish/Catalan). BusinessRep_es: Business Reputation (Spanish). IAB_en: English IAB taxonomy model. IAB_es: Spanish IAB taxonomy model. SocialMedia_en: English Social Media model. SocialMedia_es: Spanish Social Media model.

request.description:
Text Classification assigns one or more classes to a document according to their content. Classes are selected from a previously established taxonomy (a hierarchy of catergories or classes). The Text Classification API takes care of all preprocessing tasks (extracting text, tokenization, stopword removal and lemmatization) required for automatic classification.

For more information, refer to: https://www.meaningcloud.com/developer/text-classification/doc

item.description: Text Classification assigns one or more classes to a document according to their content. Classes are selected from a previously established taxonomy (a hierarchy of catergories or classes). The Text Classification API takes care of all preprocessing tasks (extracting text, tokenization, stopword removal and lemmatization) required for automatic classification.

request.description:
Simple API for sending of Emails

For more information, refer to: https://sendgrid.com/docs/API_Reference/index.html

item.name: Microsoft Translator Text

request.description:
Gets the set of languages currently supported by other operations of the Text API.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/translator/translator-info-overview

Simple text translation API

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/translator/translator-info-overview

Converts text in one language from one script to another script.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/translator/translator-info-overview

Provides alternative translations for a word and a small number of idiomatic phrases. Each translation has a part-of-speech and a list of back-translations. The back-translations enable a user to understand the translation in context. The Dictionary Example operation allows further drill down to see example uses of each translation pair.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/translator/translator-info-overview

item.description: Microsoft Translator Text API is a cloud-based machine translation service. With this API you can translate text in near real-time from any app or service through a simple REST API call. The API uses the most modern neural machine translation technology, as well as offering statistical machine translation technology.

item.name: Microsoft Text Analytics

request.description:
The API returns the detected language and a numeric score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true. A total of 120 languages are supported.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

The API returns a list of recognized entities in a given document. To get even more information on each recognized entity we recommend using the Bing Entity Search API by querying for the recognized entities names.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

The API returns a list of strings denoting the key talking points in the input text. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

item.description: The Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics web services built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction and language detection. No training data is needed to use this API; just bring your text data. This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques to deliver best in class predictions.

request.description:
The API returns a numeric score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate positive sentiment, while scores close to 0 indicate negative sentiment. A score of 0.5 indicates the lack of sentiment (e.g. a factoid statement).

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/how-tos/text-analytics-how-to-sentiment-analysis

item.name: Microsoft Language Identification

request.description:
Identifies the language of a piece of text.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/how-tos/text-analytics-how-to-language-detection

Identifies the positioning of sentence boundaries in a piece of text.

For more information, refer to: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/how-tos/text-analytics-how-to-language-detection

item.description: Microsoft Language Identification Identifies the language of any text, from a list of more than 160 languages.

item.name: Language Identification

url.raw: https://ug-api.acnapiv3.io/swivel/language-identification/lang-2.0?of=json&txt=Robert Downey Jr has topped Forbes magazine's annual list of the highest paid actors for the second year in a row. The 49-year-old star of the Iron Man and Avengers films made an estimated $75m over the past year, beating rivals Dwayne Johnson, Bradley Cooper, Chris Hemsworth and Leonardo DiCaprio.

query.description: Output format

query.value: Robert Downey Jr has topped Forbes magazine's annual list of the highest paid actors for the second year in a row. The 49-year-old star of the Iron Man and Avengers films made an estimated $75m over the past year, beating rivals Dwayne Johnson, Bradley Cooper, Chris Hemsworth and Leonardo DiCaprio.
query.description: Text input to be analyzed
URL of the content to analyze. Currently only non-authenticated HTTP and FTP are supported.
Input file with the content to analyze.

request.description:
Identifies the language of any text, from a list of more than 160 languages. It's based on the franc library, which bases the language detection process on N-grams. It supports different scripts and provides the language results using the ISO639 standard (both for two and three characters).

This API helps automatize multilingual sourced applications either by correcting a manual detection preprocessing or by avoiding it altogether.

For more information, refer to: https://www.meaningcloud.com/developer/language-identification/doc
